content.description: The distribution of housing prices in a city includes several outliers at the upper end of the distribution and no outliers at the lower end of the distribution.
content.question: Which of the following is the most resistant, or robust, measure of center of the distribution of housing prices?

choices.label: The mean, because it is affected by the outliers.
The mean, because it is not greatly affected by the outliers.
The median, because it is affected by the outliers.
The median, because it is not greatly affected by the outliers.
The mode, because the data are categorical.

content.answer: The median, because it is not greatly affected by the outliers.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
